Lecture Theatre Key.name: Lecture Theatre Key
Lecture Theatre Key.description:
Key to the Lecture Theatre in the Lecture Building.
Today, the two-story Lecture Building is adrift in the
nightmare, but once it was a place of reflection, where
scholars learned of history and archaeology.
Perhaps it still is, as the students in the lecture theatre
appear to await the return of their professor.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Lecture Building 1F, professor's desk in the unlocked hall of the Lecture Building, accessed via first floor

Laurence's Skull.name: Laurence's Skull
Laurence's Skull.description:
Skull of Laurence, first vicar of the Healing Church. 
In reality he became the first cleric beast, and his human 
skull only exists within the Nightmare. 

The skull is a symbol of Laurence's past, and what he failed
to protect. He is destined to seek his skull, but even if he 
found it, it could never restore his memories.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Research Hall, underneath the elevator that takes you to the Research Hall/the altar. From the Research Hall lamp, take the elevator/altar back down that's behind you. Send the elevator back up, but stay on the lower level. Once it goes back up another altar will appear with the Laurence's Skull item.

Short Ritual Root Chalice.name: Short Ritual Root Chalice
Short Ritual Root Chalice.description:
One of the root chalices that breaks various seals in the Old
Labyrinth.
The glass chalice, when full, is used in a short ritual to
quickly create and join a Chalice Dungeon (not for use in a 
ritual using standard materials).
Short rituals are conducted at the makeshift altar.
availability_list: Dropped by (Preset Dungeons): Pthumerian Elder in Lower Hintertomb Labyrinth L3
Patch v1.04 changes: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Iron Door Key.name: Iron Door Key
Iron Door Key.description:
Of the three great bridges that link the two cathedral
cradles, this key opens the iron door that leads to the 
midlevel bridge.
There are no thieves in the nightmare. Then, why lock a 
door? Be warned, there must be a very, very good reason.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story):  Nightmare of Mensis, you'll find this key on a corpse near the lower-most mirror during the second phase of the boss fight with Micolash, Host of the Nightmare

Underground Cell Inner Chamber Key.name: Underground Cell Inner Chamber Key
Underground Cell Inner Chamber Key.description:
Key to the inner chamber of the cell below the Grand 
Cathedral. 

The innermost chamber of the underground cell holds a lone 
madman. He wears a beast hide, and rings a bell that emits 
no sound. 

Unending death awaits those who can hear the soundless 
bell.
availability_list: Acquired from: Simon, Lighthouse Hut lamp in the Fishing Hamlet after finishing his quest line
Treasure in: Fishing Hamlet, next to Lighthouse Hut lamp, if you failed to complete the Simon's quest

White Messenger Ribbon.name: White Messenger Ribbon
White Messenger Ribbon.description:
White ribbon that messengers are oddly fond of.
A ribbon made of fine lace that shines remarkably, more suited to pretty young girls than silly old messengers.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, Canal Residence near the Plaza upon conclusion of Gascoigne's daughters quest [Return the Red Messenger Ribbon to the older sister]

Small Hair Ornament.name: Small Hair Ornament
Small Hair Ornament.description:
A small, very ordinary hair ornament.
Although it has been lost for quite some time, one can still
see signs of the care with which this tasteful ornament was
once kept.
Its colour would stand out most brilliantly against a head of 
greyish hair.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Abandoned Old Workshop, you'll find the Small Hair Ornament on a shelf in the Abandoned Old Workshop after making a very careful series of drops from the scaffolding above

Bloody Messenger Head Bandage.name: Bloody Messenger Head Bandage
Bloody Messenger Head Bandage.description:
Accessory adored by naive messengers imitating the bandages of scourge victims, unaware of their meaning. The spatters of blood give it a particularly nice touch.
The inhabitants of the stomp appear to have an interest in adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Old Yharnam, you'll need to carefully cross the rafters in the Old Yharnam church and drop to the scaffolding on the far side

Messenger Urn Festival.name: Messenger Urn Festival
Messenger Urn Festival.description:
Accessory adored by naїve messengers.
The messengers wear the urns, filled with incense that wards
off beasts, on their heads upside-down, suggesting a 
predilection to the dark.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an interest in
adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, found in hands of a corpse on the upper level of the Oedon Chapel. To reach it you'll need to ride elevator to the Healing Church Workshop and step off just before it reaches the top, then follow the rooftops back into the chapel

Hunter Chief Emblem.name: Hunter Chief Emblem
Hunter Chief Emblem.description:
A cloth emblem that belonged to the captain of the Church
hunters long ago. Opens the main gate that leads to the
round plaza of the Great Cathedral.

The main gate is shut tight on nights of the hunt, and could
only be opened from the other side with this emblem. In
other words, the captain's return, and this
emblem, determined the end of the hunt.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Lunarium Key.name: Lunarium Key
Lunarium Key.description:
Key to the lunarium facing the lake on the second floor of 
Byrgenwerth College. 
In his final years, Master Willem was fond of the lookout, 
and the rocking chair that he kept there for meditation. 
In the end, it is said, he left his secret with the lake.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Byrgenwerth, you'll find this key lying on the corner of a shelf on the third floor of Byrgenwerth's College  as you explore the observatory

Ring of Betrothal.name: Ring of Betrothal
Ring of Betrothal.description:
The inhuman beings known as the Great Ones imbued this 
ring of betrothal with some special meaning. 
In the age of the Great Ones, wedlock was a blood contract, 
only permitted to those slated to bear a special child.
availability_list: Treasure in (Preset Dungeons): Pthumeru Ihyll L2, you'll find this ring in a large treasure chest

Treasure in (Root Dungeons): e99tdh9f, F/R/C Pthumeru Ihyll L1, side area before layer lamp [tested July 23, 2017]; xffz45aq, F/R/C Pthumeru Ihyll L1, behind the first treasure door [tested Jan 01, 2018]

Celestial Dial.name: Celestial Dial
Celestial Dial.description:
A celestial dial that functions with the giant Astral Clock in 
the Grand Cathedral.

When the dial is held up towards the Astral Clock, the clock 
will come to life, and reveal a secret to its curious interloper.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Game): Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower in Astral Clocktower

Worn Messenger Top Hat.name: Worn Messenger Top Hat
Worn Messenger Top Hat.description:
A worn, rumpled top hat that messengers are oddly fond of.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an interest in
adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Dream, next to Stump Messengers as Pre-order DLC reward

Workshop Haze Extractor.name: Workshop Haze Extractor
Workshop Haze Extractor.description:
A misplace workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream.
The hunter who retrieves this can extract Arcance Haze
from ritual materials.
But alas, spent materials are lost.
availability_list: Treasure in (Preset Dungeons): Lower Pthumerian Labyrinth L2, within the coffin at the end of bonus side area before the layer boss

Yharnam Messenger Hat.name: Yharnam Messenger Hat
Yharnam Messenger Hat.description:
Hat that messengers are oddly fond of.
Commonly called a Yharnam hat.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an interest
in adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as 
babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Dream, next to Stump Messengers as Pre-order DLC reward

Eye Pendant.name: Eye Pendant
Eye Pendant.description:
An eye pendant which unlocks the surgery altar. 

There are two cathedrals in the Hunter's Dream. One lies 
past the River of Blood, and another contains the private 
research hall of the Healing Church.

Only chosen members of the Healing Church, or their 
lamentable patients, can enter the research hall, using this 
eye.

Grant eyes to the surgery altar skull.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Nightmare Grand Cathedral, held by Laurence, the First Vicar

Orphanage Key.name: Orphanage Key
Orphanage Key.description:
Key to the Orphanage, birthplace of the Choir.
The Orphanage, shadowed by the Grand Cathedral, was a
place of scholarship and experimentation, where young
orphans became potent unseen thinkers for the Healing
Church.
The Choir, that would later split from the Healing Church,
was a creation of the Orphanage.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Brainsucker, you will receive this key after killing one of the Brainsuckers behind a one-way door on the second floor of the Orphanage

Old Hunter Bell.name: Old Hunter Bell
Old Hunter Bell.description:
One of the resonating bells that cross the gaps of worlds. 
This bell is cracked and stained with the blood of beasts.

A human must expend Insight to ring this uncanny bell.

The old hunters, who have long passed from the dream but 
cannot forget the feeling of the hunt, rely upon messengers
to relay their thoughts.
Ring the bell at their side, and they are certain to give a listen.
For the night of the hunt is long, and unchanging.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): After acquiring at least one point of Insight, if you return to the Hunter's Dream you'll be able to find the Old Hunter Bell at the top of the stairs just outside the Workshop, near where you acquire the Notebook. Pick item with message "Consume Insight and ring the Old Hunter Bell to enlist the cooperation of old hunters."

Wheel Hunter Badge.name: Wheel Hunter Badge
Wheel Hunter Badge.description:
Martyr Logarius led a band of Executioners, and this badge
was crafted at their dedicated workshop. The wheel
symbolizes righteous destiny.
Their workshop was a secretive enclave of mystical beliefs
and heady fanaticism which served as the backbone of the
Executioners' unique brand of justice.
availability_list: Acquired from (Main Story): Alfred, Hunter of Vilebloods, speak to him outside of Forbidden Woods route in Cathedral Ward hand Alfred Unopened Summons found in Queen's Chamber in Forsaken Cainhurst Castle
Dropped by (Main Story): Alfred, Hunter of Vilebloods, kill him in any location other than where you first meet him

Yharnam Stone.name: Yharnam Stone
Yharnam Stone.description:
A sacred heirloom left by Yharnam, Pthumerian Queen.
The Queen lies dead, but her horrific consciousness
is only asleep, and stirs in unsettling motions.
availability_list: Acquired from (Preset Dungeons): A trophy item obtained after defeating Yharnam, Pthumerian Queen at the bottom of Pthumeru Ihyll L3

Queenly Flesh.name: Queenly Flesh
Queenly Flesh.description:
What remains of Annalise, blood queen of Cainhurst.
This pinkish lump of flesh remains warm, as if cursed.
All hail the undying queen of blood!
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, Queen's Chamber after Annalise, Queen of Castle Cainhurst being slaughtered by Alfred, Hunter of Vilebloods
Dropped by (Main Story): Annalise, Queen of Castle Cainhurst, reload after you killed her

Balcony Key.name: Balcony Key
Balcony Key.description:
Key to the balcony on the first floor of the Research Hall. 

Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower gave this to the patient, 
Adeline. 

Maria had hoped Adeline would find comfort in the faint 
breeze that carried the scent of flowers from the outside, but 
Adeline couldn't fathom her intentions.
availability_list: Acquired from: Adeline, Research Hall Patient. To obtain this key you'll first need to offer a helping hand to Adeline in the Floor 1 Laboratory room of the Research Hall. You will need to give her two of the Brain Fluids that she wants, which will mean exploring some of the Research Hall to find them; the first can be found on a staircase landing between Floor 3 and 4, and the second one is on a beam in the Upper Rafters.
Dropped by: Adeline, Research Hall Patient.

Eye of a Blood-drunk Hunter.name: Eye of a Blood-drunk Hunter
Eye of a Blood-drunk Hunter.description:
The eye of a blood-drunk hunter. Its pupil is collapsed and 
turned to mush, indicating the onset of the scourge of beasts.

A hunter who goes drunk with blood is said to be taken by 
the Nightmare, destined to wander forever, engaged in an 
endless hunt. It is a fate that no hunter can escape.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Hunter's Dream, defeat Vicar Amelia of the Cathedral Ward and examine the altar in the back of the room to change the in-game time to night. Pick up item and message will say, "The Eye of a Blood-drunk Hunter beckons hunters to the Hunter's Nightmare. A deformed creature will whisk you away outside Oedon Chapel."

Sword Hunter Badge.name: Sword Hunter Badge
Sword Hunter Badge.description:
One of the badges crafted by the Healing Church. 
The silver sword is a symbol of a Church hunter.
Ludwig was the first of many Healing Church hunters to 
come, many of whom were clerics. As it was, clerics 
transformed into the most hideous beasts.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Cleric Beast, Great Bridge in Central Yharnam

Cosmic Eye Watcher Badge.name: Cosmic Eye Watcher Badge
Cosmic Eye Watcher Badge.description:
Badge of a member of the Choir, elites of the Healing Church.
The eye signifies the very cosmos.
The Choir stumbled upon an epiphany, very suddenly and
quite by accident. Here we stand, feet planted in the earth,
but might the cosmos be very near us, only just above our
heads?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Upper Cathedral Ward, on a corpse on the base floor in the Orphanage

Saw Hunter Badge.name: Saw Hunter Badge
Saw Hunter Badge.description:
Badge crafted long ago at the Workshop. Attests to one's 
prowess as a hunter of beasts.
The Workshop is gone, and no group recognises this 
meaningless badge, except the messengers in the bath, who 
understand its profundity.
Certain things can only be entrusted with a hunter in 
possession of this badge, or so they believe.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, corpse beside the  Maneater Boar in the sewers

Powder Keg Hunter Badge.name: Powder Keg Hunter Badge
Powder Keg Hunter Badge.description:
Badge crafted by the Powder Kegs, the heretics of the
Workshop.
The Powder Kegs aboration of complex design and big
booms culminated in weapon designs that contrast with
those traditionally of the Workshop.
The late Powder Kegs, bless their souls, had a motto:
"If a weapon ain't got kick, it just ain't worth it."
availability_list: Acquired from (Main Story): Retired Hunter Djura, come into Old Yharnam from the back (have to encounter Darkbeast Paarl) and if you climb his tower without being seen he'll be friendly and you can talk to him; agree to not harm the beasts and he'll hand of the badge willingly
Dropped by (Main Story): Retired Hunter Djura, if you go up his tower straight away and fight him

Upper Cathedral Key.name: Upper Cathedral Key
Upper Cathedral Key.description:
The key to the Upper Cathedral Ward seal.
The upper echelons of the Healing Church are formed by the
School of Mensis, based in the Unseen Village, and the Choir
occupying the Upper Cathedral Ward.
This key brings one a step closer to the Choir.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Blood Moon), found in the hands of a dead Choir member in the Holding Cells

Blood Gem Workshop Tool.name: Blood Gem Workshop Tool
Blood Gem Workshop Tool.description:
A misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream.
The hunter who retrieves this can fortify weapons by
kneading blood gems into them.
Blood gems add properties to weapons when used to
fortify them, as blood defines an organism.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, chest in Library Room in Oedon Chapel after battle with Father Gascoigne

Cainhurst Badge.name: Cainhurst Badge
Cainhurst Badge.description:
Badge of the royal guards of Cainhurst, loyal guardians of
the Vileblood Queen Annalise.
The Vilebloods are hunters of blood, and hunt prey as they 
search for blood dregs. The hunter who joins them is faced
with a decision: to merely borrow their strength, or to
become one of them, heart and soul.
availability_list: Acquired from (Main Story): Annalise, Queen of Castle Cainhurst, swear an oath to the Vilebloods

Unopened Summons.name: Unopened Summons
Unopened Summons.description:
An old, sealed summons.
Like the first of its kind, it is an invitation to Cainhurst, but
for whom is not known, as it lacks addressee.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle Queen's Chamber, on a small desk to the right of the Queen Annalise's throne

Firing Hammer Badge.name: Firing Hammer Badge
Firing Hammer Badge.description:
Badge crafted by the Oto Workshop, precursor to the 
workshop of the heretical Powder Kegs.

The Powder Kegs were driven by singular ideas, and crafted 
strange weapons of great intricacy.
It is clear that the philosophy of the Powder Kegs was 
already established at this time.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Game): Beast Hunter in Hunter's Nightmare, proceed through the Hunter's Nightmare until you head down the tunnel near the Grand Cathedral. Continue on until you enter the house on the left, and follow that house downstairs and to the left. There will be a Hunter up there to fight, kill the Hunter and you'll get the badge.

Old Hunter Badge.name: Old Hunter Badge
Old Hunter Badge.description:
This hunter's badge, crafted in Gehrman's time, has no
practical purpose, except perhaps to assist in romanticising
about the past.
The badge was a special privilege for the hunters of the past,
and should not be dishonoured.
It should be left in peace, unless one is truly prepared to
assume the will of those gone before.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Gehrman, The First Hunter, you cannot obtain it early by attacking him prior to the final sequence of events at the base. To fight Gehrman, you must refuse his offer to behead you and end the nightmare

Underground Cell Key.name: Underground Cell Key
Underground Cell Key.description:
Key to the cell below the Grand Cathedral.

Hunters are held within the underground cell, so that things 
better left unseen, and knowledge better left unknown, will 
decay quietly in the fallow darkness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Research Hall, once you use the Eye Pendant to take the lift. Progress to the top of the tower and use device which raises it. And then from the lamp at the bottom, if you take the hidden path to the right on the second lift you can jump midway. Follow the path to the left, head down and then up the stairs and it will be in a little room at the far side.
You can bypass proceeding further into Research Hall and access Underground Cell Key early, by jumping from dark Patient Room 2F on to platform with the key, as seen in this video.

Messenger Top Hat.name: Messenger Top Hat
Messenger Top Hat.description:
Hat that messengers are oddly fond of.
A nice top hat rounds out any Yharnam gentleman.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an interest in 
adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Healing Church Workshop, on a broken beam in the lower section, several careful drops from upper platforms are required to reach it

Black Messenger Hat.name: Black Messenger Hat
Black Messenger Hat.description:
Hat that messengers are oddly fond of.
Symbol of the preventative hunters of 
the Healing Church.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an 
interest in adornment. Why not let them be happy,
and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, rooftop just outside of Oedon Chapel, accessed via a ladder behind the gate at the top of the nearby stairs

Rune Workshop Tool.name: Rune Workshop Tool
Rune Workshop Tool.description:
Runesmith Caryll, student of Byrgenwerth, transcribed the
inhuman utterings of the Great Ones into what are now
called Caryll Runes.

The hunter who retrieves this workshop tool can etch Caryll
Runes into the mind to attain their wondrous strength.

Provost Willem would have been proud of Caryll's runes, as
they do not rely upon blood in any measure.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hemwick Charnel Lane, corpse in the Cell after battle with Witch of Hemwick in Witch's Abode

Oedon Tomb Key.name: Oedon Tomb Key
Oedon Tomb Key.description:
Key to the gate that blocks the Tomb of Oedon. 
Beyond the tomb, Oedon Chapel can be found in the center 
of the Cathedral Ward.  

Only today the church is abandoned, and some say that the 
residents of Oedon have all gone mad.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Father Gascoigne, Central Yharnam in Tomb of Oedon

Astral Clocktower Key.name: Astral Clocktower Key
Astral Clocktower Key.description:
Key to the Astral Clocktower at the top of the Grand 
Cathedral. 

The caretaker of the tower's numerous patients, known to 
them only as Lady Maria, made her home behind the giant 
star-interpreting clock.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Game): Living Failures in Lumenwood Garden

Spark Hunter Badge.name: Spark Hunter Badge
Spark Hunter Badge.description:
Badge crafted in secret by Archibald, the infamous eccentric
of the Healing Church, for his friends.
Archibald was fascinated by the blue sparks that emanate
from the hides of the darkbeasts, and dedicated his life to its
artificial reproduction, in a style of inquiry that, incidentally,
closely followed the methodology of Byrgenwerth.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Darkbeast Paarl,Graveyard of the Darkbeast in Old Yharnam

Crow Hunter Badge.name: Crow Hunter Badge
Crow Hunter Badge.description:
Badge of a hunter of hunters, who hunts those who
have become intoxicated by their bloodlust.
The badge of the hunter of hunters is quitly
passed down from generation to generation,
usually to an outsider from the hinterlands.
To be entrusted with this cursed badge, one must
be strong, resilient to the seduction of blood,
and gracious when taking a comrade's life.
availability_list: Acquired from (Main Story): Eileen the Crow, speak to her after defeating the Blood Crow of Cainhurst
Dropped by (Main Story): Eileen the Crow, kill her at any point

Cainhurst Summons.name: Cainhurst Summons
Cainhurst Summons.description:
An old blood-stained summons, inviting an honored guest
to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst.
Rather bafflingly, it is addressed to you.
Do not hesitate; the stagecoach leaves from Hemwick  
crossing.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Iosefka's Clinic, Operation Room where you first awake after you enter the Clinic's rear entrance from the Forbidden Woods

Tonsil Stone.name: Tonsil Stone
Tonsil Stone.description:
A latticed, deformed rock, or perhaps a meteorite.
Appears useless, but possesses some old gravitational force
that prevents its riddance. A dubious soul once said:
"Step lightly round to the right of the great cathedral, and 
seek an ancient, shrouded church... The gift of the godhead
will grant you strength..."
availability_list: Acquired from (Main Story): Talk to any residential NPC after entering the Forbidden Woods, the easiest one to reach is in a house along the Village Outskirts in Forbidden Woods

Brain Fluid.name: Brain Fluid
Brain Fluid.description:
Dropped by Enlarged Head at the top of Research Hall:
Greyish amoeba-shaped brain fluid. Wobbles and bounces.

Extracted from a patient whose head expanded until that
was all that they were.
In the early days of the Healing Church, the Great Ones were 
linked to the ocean, and so the cerebral patients would imbibe 
water, and listen for the howl of the sea. Brain fluid writhed 
inside the head, the initial makings of internal eyes.
Dropped by Enlarged Head before Living Failures (near NPC Hunter):
Greyish amoeba-shaped brain fluid. Wobbles and bounces.

Extracted from a patient whose head expanded until that
was all that they were.
Once, a young girl had an older brother who was determined to 
become a doctor, and so she wilfully became his patient. In the
 end, this led to their encounter with the Eldritch Truth, 
for which they considered themselves blessed.
Dropped by Adeline, Research Hall Patient:
Greyish amoeba-shaped brain fluid. Wobbles and bounces.

Extracted from a patient whose head expanded until that
was all that they were.
We fail to realize our own latent potential, until the
moment it is lost, and we sense its absence. Ironically,
this is the very nature of insight, like the moment one
licks one's own blood, only to be startled by its sweetness.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Game): Two Enlarged Heads in Research Hall. For the 3rd Brain Fluid you need to kill Adeline, Research Hall Patient once she turned into Enlarged Head in the corner of the room. She comes back to live after you picked up the Brain Fluid.

Radiant Sword Hunter Badge.name: Radiant Sword Hunter Badge
Radiant Sword Hunter Badge.description:
One of the badges crafted by the Healing Church.
The radiant sword indicates the heirs to the will of Ludwig.
These hunters, also known as Holy Blades, are what remains
of an ancient line of heroes that date back to a very early
age of honour and chivalry.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Healing Church Workshop, treasure chest on the top floor of the tower; it's just outside the door to Upper Cathedral Ward

Red Messenger Ribbon.name: Red Messenger Ribbon
Red Messenger Ribbon.description:
Red ribbon that messengers are oddly fond of.
The thick, pungent red was drawn from the organs
of some unfortunate victim.
A strange choice indeed, but perhaps for the messengers
wearing this accessory constitutes a form of mourning.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Maneater Boar in Central Yharnam sewers during Gascoigne daughter's quest

Messenger Head Bandage.name: Messenger Head Bandage
Messenger Head Bandage.description:
Accessory adored by naїve messengers imitating the
bandages of scourge victims, unaware of their meaning.
The inhabitants of the stump appear to have an interest in
adornment. Why not let them be happy, and revel as babes?
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Dream, next to Stump Messengers as  Pre-order DLC reward
